topic: Generative AI Guidelines

  entities:
    Generative Foundation Models|Model
    Accountability|Social Concept
    Robustness|Technological Concept
    Harmlessness|Social Concept
    Helpfulness|Social Concept
    Information Reliability|Technological Concept
    Privacy|Social Concept
    UK AI Regulation|Regulation
    Trustworthiness Framework|Framework

  proposition: Accountability is a key principle to be improved in multiple laws and acts.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Accountability|DESCRIBED_BY|key principle
    Accountability|REQUIRES|improvement in laws and acts

  proposition: Guideline 5: Generative Model Robustness Requirements
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|REQUIRES|Robustness

  proposition: Generative models should demonstrate robustness against adversarial attacks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_WITHSTAND|adversarial attacks

  proposition: Generative models must be capable of handling rare or unusual inputs.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABLE_OF|handling rare or unusual inputs

  proposition: Continuous updates and testing are necessary to maintain model robustness.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|REQUIRES|continuous updates
    Generative Foundation Models|REQUIRES|continuous testing

  proposition: UK AI regulation defines robustness as one of five core principles.
    entity-entity relationships:
    UK AI Regulation|DEFINES|Robustness

  proposition: The model must prioritize harmlessness while maximizing helpfulness.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|PRIORITIZES|Harmlessness
    Generative Foundation Models|MAXIMIZES|Helpfulness

  proposition: Models should not generate content causing potential harm in human interactions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_AVOID|generating harmful content

  proposition: Models must generate reliable and accurate information.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_GENERATE|reliable information
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_GENERATE|accurate information

  proposition: When information is uncertain or speculative, models must clearly communicate uncertainty.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_COMMUNICATE|uncertainty

  proposition: Generative models must ensure privacy protection for user inputs and generated information.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_PROTECT|user privacy
    Generative Foundation Models|MUST_PROTECT|generated information

  proposition: Trustworthiness is a multifaceted concept without rigid universal rules.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Trustworthiness Framework|DESCRIBED_BY|multifaceted concept
    Trustworthiness Framework|LACKS|rigid universal rules

  proposition: Guidelines address fairness, transparency, human oversight, accountability, and ethical norms.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Trustworthiness Framework|ADDRESSES|fairness
    Trustworthiness Framework|ADDRESSES|transparency
    Trustworthiness Framework|ADDRESSES|human oversight
    Trustworthiness Framework|ADDRESSES|accountability
    Trustworthiness Framework|ADDRESSES|ethical norms

  proposition: The framework aims to align generative foundation models with ethical and legal standards.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Trustworthiness Framework|ALIGNS|Generative Foundation Models
    Trustworthiness Framework|TARGETS|ethical standards
    Trustworthiness Framework|TARGETS|legal standards
